messages.message:
Hey Guys, could someone help have a look at this. My sandbox update is running since 2.5 hours and the last time it had timed out.  https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1719343930829729. I'm seeing this now
```10:50:35  SAAS-AWS » saas-pipelines » install-ib-platform #10586 completed with status UNSTABLE (propagate: false to ignore)
10:50:35  org.jenkinsci.plugins.workflow.actions.ErrorAction$ErrorId: 71465e70-6804-4b76-a4e5-7c10dbd15b73
10:50:35  Finished: UNSTABLE```

```09:04:15  + kubectl rollout status statefulset/statefulset-weaviate -n insan-use2-skhatri-debug-instabase
10:50:29  Cancelling nested steps due to timeout
10:50:29  Sending interrupt signal to process
10:50:29  Waiting for 2 pods to be ready...
10:50:29  script returned exit code 1
10:50:30  [Pipeline] echo
10:50:30  Rollout for resource statefulset-weaviate failed. Output: org.jenkinsci.plugins.workflow.steps.FlowInterruptedException
10:50:30  [Pipeline] }```
@Cody Boggs Would you know how to debug this further ?

usually any time I see this, I end up in DM for the cluster and seeing if the failing service is still configured for 0 replicas. Usually seems to indicate that a revive job didn't delete the scale-down patches from the previous hibernate :disappointed:
If the last thing you see for the config on the specific thing you wanna fix (weaviate here) is a patch to reduce replicas, just delete that patch and it should come up
Then you can rebuild from ICC
Ok, I how do I do that. I have no idea.
In the admiral console for your sandbox there should be a link to open DM, you can navigate from there :slightly_smiling_face: If you run into more issues I'd ping someone in <#C058UFAGWTF|> perhaps
